name: Overview of EFS Status Codes
title: Overview of EFS Status Codes
body:
Overview

EFS uses a lot of codes across lots of tables, which can only be found as constants in the code. This article is meant to document the status codes that you may find in the database, so you can better "read" the config.

This information is provided on a best-effort basis thanks to the legacy Tivian team.

Table of Contents

  • Project Status
  • Dispositionscode
  • Project type
  • Page type
  • Question type
  • Panelstatus:
  • Panel entry mode (pinput)
  • Panel Doublettenstatus (doub_stat)
  • Defaults Missing Values:
  • Page History
  • Jobstatus
  • Status of mails in the mails table:
  • SMS and mail sending codes from mail_rcpt
  • Archiving status of groups
  • Rights status
  • EFS Teams (standard)
  • Status Bonus Points
  • Reporting+ Codes
  • Sample status
  • Last edited by
  • Codes for survey_session Table
  • EFS Codes for last_page and page_history
  • StatusCodes Mysql
  • Portal Codes for portal_user_codes
  • Codes for panel_action_log
  • Codes for profile_visibility in the panel_att table
  • Codes for the panel tracking in the panel_tracking_log_permanent table
  • Portals: Codes for status in portal_user_status

Panel Entry Mode (pinput)

  • Table: panel_att

  • Column: pinput

Entry mode. Describes the type of registration. It is automatically assigned by the system. There are the following entry modes:
1 ==> other event
2 ==> data import
4 ==> moderator entry
8 ==> self-recruited
16 ==> referral
32 ==> test
64 ==> INVITED
127 ==> SELF_REGISTERED

Please note: The entry mode is not to be confused with the entry paths, which are stored in the variable "reg_code". You can use user-defined entry paths to describe exactly how panelists with entry mode 1, 2, 8 and 16 got into the panel. See also chapter 6.2, p. 110.

 

Panel Duplicate Status (doub_stat)

  • Table: panel_att

  • Column: doub_stat

Duplicate status. Has the check been carried out for the panelist and what is the result:
0 ==> Unchecked
1 ==> No duplicate
10 ==> Duplicate

 

Defaults Missing Values:

Status

Meaning

0

Question was seen but not answered

-77

Participant did not see the question (dropped out or because of filter)

-66

Participant did not see the question because it was hidden

-99

(for text fields) The participant has seen the respective question but has not answered it

SMS  and mail sending

##### POSTMAN COULDN'T SEND: 1 - 3

1 => corresponds to the type, we distinguish between mail (1) and  SMS  (2)
3 => corresponds to the value from the table below

In the new table, the code 1 is omitted: 11 has long since taken the place of 1: const ERR_INVALID_RECIPIENT = 11; //was formerly 1, but the value was senseless because 1 means "delivered", so now this status gets 11

Hurricane Indicators

Mail status indicators:

  • Queued,

  • Sent,

  • Spam,

  • Delivery failed,

  • Not reachable.

 

The mail recipient's disposition code will be changed during the process.

  • survey_dispositioncodes::DISPCODE_ACTIVE (12) if the mail was successful.

  • survey_dispositioncodes::DISPCODE_NOT_AVAILABLE(15) if the recipient is not reachable. (see Efs_Mail_Status::STATUS_UNREACHABLE)

  • survey_dispositioncodes::DISPCODE_NO_CONTACT(14) , all other statuses.

 

The indicators are stored in the class Efs_Mail_Engine_Hurricane_Notification_Codes. In the folders

  • modules/efs/components/mail/engine/hurricane/notification und

  • modules/efs/components/mail/engine/connector

contains all files required for MBM phases 1 and 4.

Table: survey_reporting_publication_job
Column: status

Job Status

Meaning

-1

STATE_ABORTED = job was aborted

0

STATE_NEW = job is new and was not triggered yet

1

STATE_RUNNING = job is currently running

2

STATE_FINISHED = job is finished

3

STATE_RECOVERABLE = job was aborted, but may work next time

4

STATE_PPT_LIMIT = job failed due to ppt limit

5

STATE_XLS_LIMIT = job failed due to xls limit

Codes for profile_visibility in the panel_att table

Here, several options are stored together in a variable. Each bit or each position in the binary representation represents an option. If you want to check whether a certain option is set, divide the stored number by the decimal value of the corresponding bit (rounding down) and use the modulo operation to check whether the result is even or odd. For example: 

select pseudonym from panel_att where MOD(floor(profile_visibility/32768),2)=1;

 

Option

Value

Codes for the panel tracking in the panel_tracking_log_permanent table

With 17.3, new codes were added here too, corresponding to the new disposition codes: New disposition codes were introduced, they are related to already existing codes.

  • Custom completed 1 (33) and Custom completed 2 (34) are related to Completed (31).

  • Custom screen out 1 (38), Custom screen out 2 (39) and Custom screen out 3 (40) are related to Screened out (37)

  • Custom unavailable 1 (18) and Custom unavailable 2 (19) are related to Cannot be reached (15)

  • Reserved 1 (16) and Reserved 2 (17) are related to Invited (12)
